tutorials.title: What is: Data Science
tutorials.description: An introduction to the world of data science.

components.content: Data Science is a multidisciplinary field that fuses statistics, computer science, and domain knowledge.

It aims to derive actionable insights from complex and unstructured data. Data Science often involves creating machine learning models to make predictions or decisions without explicit human instructions.

components.description: One popular Python library for Data Science is Pandas, which can be installed as follows:

components.code:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('data.csv')
print(df.head())

components.content: Data Science not only revolves around analyzing data but also involves visualizing, cleaning, and interpreting it. The main goal is to answer questions and derive knowledge from vast amounts of data.

components.description: Matplotlib is a Python library for data visualization, which can be installed as follows:
Visualizing data can be achieved with libraries like Matplotlib:
components.code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df['column_name'].plot(kind='hist')
plt.show()

tutorials.title: Importance
tutorials.description: Understanding the impact of data science in the modern world.

components.text: Data Science has become crucial in decision-making processes for businesses, governments, and organizations. Its importance stems from the capability to turn raw data into valuable insights, enabling informed decisions.
It drives automation, AI innovations, and helps in predicting future trends and behaviors.

components.next_tutorial_title: Identify the different types of data

tutorials.title: Data Types
tutorials.description: Learning about various data types in data science.

components.text: There are various types of data in data science:

1. Structured Data: Organized data, typically in tables.
2. Unstructured Data: Data that doesn't have a pre-defined format, like texts or images.
3. Semi-structured Data: A mix, like JSON or XML files.
4. Time-series Data: Data points collected or recorded at specific time intervals.
